result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Devonta Jamall Thomas

records.addlTxt: Affidavit and order for payment of attorney fees and costs due from Milwaukee County signed.  Filed by:    ANNETTE  RAUCH  $1,280.00
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Status Report 10-18-2022
Received and Filed. NOTICE OF MOTION AND MOTION TO WITHDRAW AS COUNSEL FOR DEFENDANT

Defendant's appearance waived.  Case adjourned due to attorney Ashley Fard in trial on another matter.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 11:00 am; both parties agreed to date, via email.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 8-19-2022

Defendant Devonta J Thomas in court with attorney Ashley Fard.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Status Conference. Discussion with parties. Defense counsel advises that there may be a possible global resolution. Court sets next court date for a Plea/ Sentencing Hearing. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 5-6-2022

Defendant Devonta Jamall Thomas in court with Attorney Ashley Fard.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Nicholas Beckett    State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.
  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Case adjourned to Br. 16.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 3-23-2022

Defendant Devonta Jamall Thomas in court.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO. 
Case in court for a Preliminary hearing. Defendant is not present. State's witness is present. Defense requests an adjournment to align with defendant's pending matter. Court impose and stay a bench warrant until the next court date. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 2-22-2022
22RM003787  Actual Date Bond Posted with *sheriff 2/2/2022
Due to the defendants lower pending matter (21CF2439) this matter is re-assigned to Br. 16 Judge Grayson.

Defendant Devonta Jamall Thomas in court with Attorney Ashley Fard.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Attorney Fard is newly appointed and needs time to meet with her client. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 1-27-2022, Filed.
Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel, Filed.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with AMA and SS

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  
No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Devonta Jamall Thomas in court with attorney Ruby De Leon.  Defendant Devonta Jamall Thomas in custody.  Anthony J Moore appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Devonta Jamall Thomas appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
